_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Administration of Air and Water Resource and Solid Waste Management Programs

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Emergency Coordinator determines the existence or probability of on-site casualties and is responsible for activating the casualty control plan.

1. The Emergency Coordinator will access the casualty situation and assist the responding emergency medical assistance.

2. The Emergency Coordinator will provide assistance to coordinate search and rescue efforts.

3. The Emergency Coordinator will designate, organize and direct available first-aid personnel.

The first-aid station will be located at a pre-designated area which will be influenced by the prevailing wind conditions.  For whichever site determined by the Emergency Coordinator to be the one of choice for the particular incident, there will be accessibility allowances made for the emergency vehicles so that their entrance to the emergency situation will not be impeded.

4.  Casualties who can safely walk shall be directed to the first-aid station.

5.  The Emergency Coordinator will designate a technical person to help identify injury-causing hazardous agents and provide any pertinent information on agent toxicity.

6.  The Emergency Coordinator will have incoming emergency/medical assistance met and guided to the first-aid station or location of an on-site emergency.

7.  Upon arrival of Emergency Medical Service, the control of casualty treatment and disposition will transfer to the medical service person in charge.  The Emergency Coordinator will place himself and the resources of the plant under the director of the medical service person in charge.

8.  After the medical service determines where casualties will be taken, he will notify the appropriate hospital emergency room of the arrival of casualties, the nature of the injuries, and any information deemed necessary for that particular incident.

The following hospitals have been notified of potential hazards and will be given a copy of this emergency response program which is to be implemented in the event of an emergency:


University Hospital and

Medical Center
7201 North University Drive
Tamarac, Florida   33321
(954) 721-2200

Northwest Medical Center
2801 North State Road 7
Margate, Florida   33063
(954) 974-0400
